meanings.definition: A large rock or boulder, especially one that has been smoothed by erosion.
meanings.sent1: The bowlder stood majestically at the edge of the river.
meanings.sent2: We climbed the bowlder to get a better view of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The bowlder seemed to be smiling as the sun shone on its smooth surface.
meanings.sent4: The bowlder's presence in the landscape was as solid as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The children played hide-and-seek behind the bowlder, giggling with delight.

meanings.definition: To remove boulders or rocks from an area.
meanings.sent1: We need to bowlder the construction site before we can start building.
meanings.sent2: The workers will bowlder the path to make it safer for hikers.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could bowlder all the clutter from my room as easily as in a video game.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to bowlder away all the worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The music had a calming effect, as if it could bowlder away all stress and tension.

meanings.definition: A person who removes boulders or rocks from an area.
meanings.sent1: The bowlder was known throughout the village for his strength and hard work.
meanings.sent2: She hired a bowlder to clear the field for her new garden.
meanings.sent3: The bowlder's muscles rippled as he effortlessly lifted the heavy rocks.
meanings.sent4: She was a bowlder in the community, always ready to help with physical tasks.
meanings.sent5: The bowlder's determination was as unyielding as the rocks he moved.
